dialogues.Nun:
[1]You two boys need a ride? 
[2]You both don't have to sit back there. One of you can sit up here with me. 
[3]So where are you boys from? 
[4]What brings you to Indiana? 
[5]Hollywood, hunh? That's a long ways away. 
[6]Well, do unto others. That's what the Book says. 
[7]I live my life by it. 
[8]Of course. You know how lonely it gets on the road? Thanks to the Book, I'm never alone--if you know what I mean. 
[9]Are you kidding? I've dedicated my life to it. Every hour of every day. 
[10]You live by the Book, too? 
[11]That's good to hear. But it takes deed, not words. It's a lot easier to say you live by the Book than to actually do it. Can you do it? 
[12]No time like the present, right?
